title: Boston Archdiocese calls on Dedham church to remove Nativity scene protesting ICE
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “The display should be removed, and the manger restored to its proper sacred purpose," the Archdiocese of Boston said in a statement.
The Nativity scene at St.
Susanna Parish, missing the baby Jesus, with a protest sign saying "ICE was here.

title: Revisiting our bold Patriots preseason predictions at bye week
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Several preseason predictions for the Patriots haven't aged all that well amid an 11-2 start to the year.

title: 3-year-old dies after being struck by vehicle on Cape Cod
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The toddler, who was not identified, died at a local hospital.
The driver remained at the scene and cooperated with law enforcement, prosecutors said.
A 3-year-old child was struck and killed by a vehicle in East Sandwich Sunday afternoon, officials announced.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Melissa McCarthy hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: TV Melissa McCarthy hosted the Dec.
6 episode of "Saturday Night Live," with Dijon as musical guest.
SNL recap: Musical guest Dijon, host Melissa McCarthy, and Kenan Thompson ahead of the December 6 episode of "Saturday Night Live.

title: Endangered whale that traveled 3,000 miles from Ireland spotted off Boston’s coast
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Environment This sighting is the first documented case of a right whale traveling east to west initially, instead of the other way around.
Comparisons between the right whale as seen in Ireland last year (left) and in Boston this year (right).

Naomi D’arcy and Center for Coastal Studies By Darin Zullo December 7, 2025 | 11:36 AM 2 minutes to read The discovery of an endangered whale sighted off the coast of Boston gave researchers an incredibly unique “tail” to tell.

title: Detained Tufts student’s lawyers push for restoration of her student record
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The removal of Rümeysa Öztürk’s student record since her release from ICE custody has kept her from teaching and research opportunities.
Rümeysa Öztürk speaks at a press conference May 10 after her release from ICE detention in Louisiana.

Matthew J Lee/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo December 7, 2025 | 10:47 AM 2 minutes to read Attorneys representing Rümeysa Öztürk, a Tufts University graduate student who was detained by federal authorities in March, asked a federal judge Thursday to restore her student record in an Immigration and Customs Enforcement database.

title: Felony riot charges dropped against Oct. 7 pro-Palestinian protestors, now facing misdemeanors
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The riot charges were initially added to misdemeanor charges that the protesters were facing, but have since been dropped.
Boston police officers detain a protestor during a pro-Palestinian protest.
Bryan Hecht/Berkeley Beacon By Darin Zullo December 7, 2025 | 9:58 AM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: 5 intriguing NFL matchups to watch during Patriots bye week
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: New England Patriots Multiple games on Sunday will carry major playoff implications in the AFC.
The Chiefs' playoff hopes could shift dramatically this week.
(AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) The Patriots won’t be taking the field in Week 14, but across the NFL there are plenty of important matchups that could affect the playoff picture in the AFC.
